8143204.review:
There aren't many games that fit the genre of roguelikes on Steam. [b]Dungeons of Dredmor[/b] is one of them, [b]Sword of the Stars: The Pit[/b] is another one.
[b]Tales of Maj'Eyal[/b] is a roguelike game in it's truest sense, however, it has some gameplay elements that I personally didn't see occuring that much in other RL games like [b]ADOM[/b].
For one, there is pretty much no division between activatable skills and magic spells (something like what [b]Dungeons of Dredmor[/b] does). The main difference between them is that different classes use different types of power points (warrior classes use stamina, arcane mages use mana, hate for afflicted classes) that behave differently (mana gets restored with time for magic classes while hate is only increased by hitting hard and taking damage).
Another major difference is the absense of magical potions or scrolls. Those are replaced by infustions. A character can store a limited amount of infusions that can be activated any number of times (those can be replaced by new infusions), except that they have a cooldown. This greatly changes the health restoration system other roguelikes and action-RPG games have. Instead of stacking with a huge amount of potions that you drink at will, you have to take note of how much health you have, how much you lose in combat, and how many turns do you have to survive until you can use another infusion.
The game itself can be downloaded for free from [b]te4.org[/b]. Buying ToME from Steam automatically makes you a donator, which unlocks an additional class for dwarven characters, a somewhat easier exploration mode that allows you to revive your character unlimited amount of times, and an ability to share a limited amount of items with your other characters.

8117773.review:
This game is FOR FREE at thier website.

If you want a deep but easy to play roguelike with [b]massive[/b] replayability due to the unique classes available with profound customization for each class. Then look no further. I've never played a game where you can erase the [b]existence[/b] of an enemy through temporal powers, become a dragon wielding a massive two handed sword with various dragon-breathes, murder people in their sleep (literally), and even create a small undead army at your disposal. 

This game has been carefully crafted in various ways, for one the grind that's in some games is gone in this game, where shops restock only by your progress into the main campain and you later get a item that seperates what you find from your invintory until you decide to put it in your invintory, then, there's the fact that enemies you face have various tactics. For example, a corruptor can conjure bone sheild that negates all damage for 3 attacks! So if you never invested in a way to deal multiple hits with one attack, you'll have a more difficult time! Then the UI and interface is fully costimizable, you can even auto cast spells, such as buffs and take them off your UI!

There are various items that have unique prefix-suffixs stats and effects attached to them, much like diablo or torchlight for example. Many powerful items are guarentied to drop from a boss, (aka a yellow artifact item) and if the item doesn't suite your need, you can store it away for the next character you make to use! If you don't even want to use that item, then you can convert into not just gold, but into [b]energy[/b] for a special building you acuire. The progession of this game is really solid and at times depend on your race, as some races level up more slowly, but are inately stonger then others. There are plenty of random events and quests that you can undertake, yet they aren't completely random to the point of unfairness.

The skills and abilities you can accuire are amazing and unique! You can create a [b]gravity[/b] mage, or a invincible sword and board user that utilizes deadly counterattacks, or even a summoner where you can sacrifice creatures for various effects or contorl creatures to make one powerful creature! Then you have player races with unique abilities as well, for example a dwarf can eventually phase through walls, and a ghoul that can basically throw up on the ground that damages enemies and heals you! Last you have prodigies that are power and unique feats you acuire later on in the game, for example you can have a effect where an attack will kill you, but you'll save yourself from death, while slowly losing life to the point where if you don't heal you'll actually die!

The main story is quite interesting and there's a ton of lore that you'll find and is quite deep. Some of this lore can help you find secrets through-out the world and clear up some of the strangest things you'll encounter... There are various difficulties available, so you can have a more casual experience by not losing your hero after he dies, or a more hardcore one where you have one life to live with stronger enemies! There are also various other adventures you can have, without downloading anything extra, for example you can enter into a arena if you just want some good old action, or if you want to have the old experience where it's just you and a dungeon, then you can enter into the infinite dungeon and never look back!

In fact, I never looked back after playing this game, and never regreted it. There are plenty of games that are not worth your money or time, and this [b]not[/b] one of them due to the quality of the mechanics and diversity of character crafting.

8112442.review: Glad this got greenlit!  This has been a go to game for me for a long time.

8107544.review: A fun roguelike that has hours and hours of replay value, expect to die and curse a lot when you're new. Also has an online chat feature built into the game that makes for an interesting interactive experience. Has plenty of achievements, server events, and other features.

8101452.review: YES!  ToME is finally on steam!  If you have never played this game, you can download a copy to try at te4.org.  If you enjoy tactical RPGs and rogue-likes, forget trying it, just go buy it, now.  I have been playing this game since about halfway through its beta, and its truly an amazing game.  Punishingly hard if you are careless, but rewards those who learn to really use the abilities of their character.  And oh, the abilities.  Pick one of the 24 (!) classes (fewer at first--you have to unlock the advanced classes through gameplay; this is a good thing, as you would get slaughtered playing these classes as a new player!) and pick one of the 9 races (again, some require unlocks).  These combine to determine which ability groups you get to put points into.  And points can be scarce--pretty much all character classes can be played 2 or 3 different ways, and some can be done 4 or more different ways, depending upon how you spread your points around.  Add in a mostly-fixed overland map with mostly-procedurally generated dungeons and some tough boss and miniboss fights and an amazingly varied loot system...and you've got a game with frightening levels of replayability.  And for good measure, add a developer (All hail DarkGod!) who listens to feedback, talks with his players on the forums, and seems to spend more time than is physically posible working on the game.  (Maybe he is a Chronomancer?)  What are you waiting for?

8083318.review:
Best Roguelike since Dungeon Crawl: Stone Soup.
Stone Soup set the bar and Tales of Maj'Eyal has been the ONLY one to surpass it in my opinion.

I am extremely impressed with the level of character customization. Most RPG's give you "choice," but if you don't "choose" one of three builds, you die. In Maj'Eyal I feel like I can actually build a unique and powerful character.

So yes, as someone who is very disappointed in the state of today's Roguelikes, I am happy to think of all the hours I'll be putting into this one.

8081622.review:
One of the finest roguelikes ever created; I'm really happy to see this on Steam, and more than happy to support it by buying a copy having been a freebie player for years.

Massive depth in character creation and customization, a huge amount of variety and a vast campaign to work through will keep you busy for years -- yet at the same time excellent tutorials and helpful on-screen feedback mean you'll never feel like the game is withholding information from you. And with Steam Workshop support, adding mods to the game and tweaking it to your own tastes is easier than ever.

If you've only recently come to the genre through stuff like Dungeons of Dredmor, FTL and Rogue Legacy, do yourself a favour and check this out -- you won't regret it.

8080638.review: I love this game!  ToME is probably my most-played game of the last year or so, and for good reason.  It is challenging and rewards sound strategy.  The mythology is rich and ever-growing, and the community that has sprung up around the game is the sort of environment that fosters cooperation and creativity.  Thank you, DarkGod, for making this game so rewarding!

8077005.review: Tales of Maj'Eyal is a fantastic roguelike. As a roguelike its simple to learn and also have complexity. A skill system akin to Diablo 2 allows unique character builds within classes. Skills have cooldowns, this works very well in the turn based structure especially combined with effects that effect cooldown time. Inventory management is simple to use and relatively limited item slots create thoughtful decisions. As a long term player of roguelikes I highly recommend Tales of Maj'Eyal to beginners and roguelike veterans alike.

Tales of Maj'Eyal is for those of us who cannot say no to a challenge. The combat mechanics is very intricate and there are thousands of combinations. There are many classes and races to choose from. Each class is sculpted in such a way that no one class will feel the same as the other. There's also an amazing and rich lore behind the game that you find as you explore its many dungeons.

8070867.review: The thing about this game, apart from the fact that it's awesome, is that it can appeal to any skill level and ease you into its depth, unlike many other rogue-likes out there.  Perhaps it's just me, but I barely had to look anything up.  Everything is well laid out and there are plenty of tool tips to explain everything.  The UI is fantastic and the game even runs on my netbook.  There are also difficulty settings to grant either permadeath or a more forgiving "lives" system that you gain extra lives as you level up, or even no death at all (but no achievements either).  Overall, I'm blown away so far and can easily see myself spending dozens if not hundreds of hours playing every single class... And the fact that you slowly unlock classes as you play is brilliant.  Now I know why this won rogue-like of the year a few times in a row.  Buy it because these games need the support!

This game is fantastic.  For the price you can't beat what the game offers.  Tons of races and classes.  Incredibly indepth RPG elements.  Fantastic difficulty that punishes you for your mistakes and is otherwise balanced.  A nice soundtrack with immersive audio like birds chirping or dogs barking in the distance.  The game is also entirely randomized so no playthrough is the same as the one previous, except for story events.

I have played ToME off and on for years.. and would like to tell you how great it is to see this on Steam finally.  This game is an RPG players dream, so so complex and sort of complicated.  Has three settings, Adventure which is limited lives, Rogue which is true one life play, and then some other setting I really hope you don't play on which has unlimited lives. 

 The world is pretty massive, with towns and dungeons and random events, some based on your stats I beleive. The fact that races and classes, which are plentiful, are unlocked by completeing quests and achievments is MORE then enough to make you want to play this all night.

8058830.review:
Wow. If you have any love whatsoever for old-school roguelikes, Tales of Maj'Eyal cleans up lots of the muck and interface insanity and delivers one of the most polished, fun and narrative takes on the genre.

Things are on a cooldown system and combat is very stragetic. The one down side to this game is it takes a while to learn. When you start out, you only have 3 or 4 classes you can use. You will die. You will probably die a lot. With that said, the game is honestly quite fun and almost entirely fair. Fairness in a Roguelike is, of course, a bit subjective, but you will very rarely run into dead before you know what hit you situations. For those of you who aren't into the "One Life to Live" concept of Roguelikes, there is a mode that lets you have extra lives at set points so that dire badger isn't the end of your career.

The classes are varied and each have their unique flair, transparency in mobs is pretty great even though there'll still be a learning curve here or there and it has a ridiculous amount of achievements for those who thrive on that.

8053118.review:
One of the most entertaining and well done rogue-likes I've played in a long time. The UI is understandable, there's tooltips for pretty much everything - In essence everything missing from a lot of rogue-likes. And that is just the shinies - The game itself is very deep as well. 

There's a very well made 'story' mode (it is HARD the first 100 times you try :)) and you will quickly unlock the regular rogue-like endless dungeon (which can also be accessed by a story-mode character once you've completed the story).

There's tons of races and classes, a lot of which needs to be unlocked from playing the story - They classes play very differently, with huge scope for customization, so almost endless replayability.

I could go on - This is probably one of my most played games of all time - If you have ANY love for rogue-likes - Or looking to try one that is easy to get into - this is the game for you.

8053061.review:
A very fun, old-style roguelike with lots of places to explore, quests to find and do and things to unlock.  It has a good amount of felxibility in the permadeath department as well, ranging from Eploration (unlimited lives) to Roguelike (when they die, they die for good) with a bit of a middle ground which lets you earn extra lives at various levels.

The ability bar and cooldown system, which does away with consumables like potions in favor of reusable abilities which grant regeneration, bonuses to defense, mana restoration or a number of other things, is a very welcome addition and streamlines things nicely, so you can easily activate your special abilities and know where you stand on how long until it can be used again at a glance.

I'm very impressed with it and looking forward to exploring the secrets of Maj'Eyal.

8050891.review: "It's not all about the graphics." We've all heard it before. Well this game is a true testament to that. I was not expecting what I got out of this. Loot galore that even changes how your character looks (I know this is important to some, myself included). You can play traditional roguelike with permadeath, semi-roguelike with limited revives, and adventure mode with as many revives as you want. With the character progression, large world, varied quests, and enemies everywhere, I can't stop playing. This game is easily worth the money.

I have been playing Tales of Maj'Eyal (TOME4) for years and I have quite enjoyed it.  Very few games have staying power for me anymore even to the point of completing them before moving on.  I have played through TOME4 several times now completely and have in excess of 200+ attempts :)

I highly recommend it for Roguelike players and for more casual players as there are quite a few configurations that will allow you to decide at what difficulty level you wish to play.

The truly amazing thing, in my mind, about this game is that it deviates from the commercial (fighter/caster/cleric) mindset.  Each class is a very different experience and interesting experience with a wide variety of powers and options.

This is one of the very few games that I see myself still playing in the years to come.  For this price and the amount of content, this game is a steal.

8037240.review:
I'm totally blown away by how fun and how well made this game is.  Small price, small download size, but BIG fun!  It's a nice looking tile set roguelike RPG with a tactical turn-based combat system.  I suggest not using the 'auto-explore' feature so you can get the sense of actually lurking around and wondering what's around the corner, or behind the next door.  Surprisingly enough, you'll come face to face with rare mobs on a fairly regular basis with nice loot, but they're not just going to hand them over to you.  No Siry Bob....you'll have to take it from his/her/it's cold-dead, clawing/oozing/hairy or whatever type of hand.
Lots of choices on the type of character you want to play, and you actually unlock more options of all kinds to make your next play characters even better or to try something completely different.  Don't worry, you'll be playing more characters you can count on it.  You can only die so many times, if at all, before your character goes bye-bye to the beyond.  Just use his death as a great excuse to try out that new unlocked race/class/gear or whatever.
Anyways, try it out, I'm sure some of you will be caught off-guard by how fun and good the game is for it's download size and price as I mentioned.
Oh and forgot to say something for achievement fans.  There's slightly over 1,200 achievements in the game, so I'm sure that will tickle your fancy.

8037124.review: If you want to play a pretty cool roguelike game then this one is pretty darn cool.  I love to sit down and play it when I am not in the mood for anything else! :)

The only hurdle you need to get over is the visual style. Look at the screenshots. What you see is what you get; and i LOVE it!!!

8035502.review: Highly recommend this to ANY roguelike fan, or someone looking for a grand adventure they can fully customize. Tales of Maj'Eyal is a game brimming with content, depth, and hard work. In the character creation screen alone you will see how many races and classes are offered to you from the start, let alone unlockable through various quests and gameplay. Speaking of gameplay, it's everything you could ask for in a roguelike. Plays super easily, and one quick tutorial will get you ready to take on the world. There's so much to discover and try out, you will get an enormous value out of this game. Definitely give it a shot!

8035261.review:
This is such a deep, challenging, engrossing and replayable game. There really aren't enough games like this in the world! A really excellent roguelike, with a great UI and a lot of the chaff cut out. It's very combat centric, but with a believable world and a lot of great gameplay options. Rather importantly the designer has not been afraid to throw out poor features - potions are replaced by limited cooldowns, hunger clock doesn't exist, no item identification, etc. It's so focussed, and because it's so focussed it goes into extreme depth in producing a complex and interesting experience.

There's a good reason this has won Roguelike of the Year for many years running - it's simply the best there is, in a class of its own. There are lots of other great roguelikes of course, but there's only one ToME.

8035210.review:
Take a roguelike and a modern game, put them together in a blender, and what do you get? ToME: Classic turn-based fantasy mixed with modern features such as highly impressive graphical effects, achievements, content unlocking, etc.

While it doesn't go beyond the usual set of boring fantasy races, it DOES have a massive selection of classes that act in extremely different ways to each other. Even the default fighter (called a Bulwark) isn't even close to the usual "bump until it dies" fighter of other roguelikes.

Even if you're new to the genre, ToME can be a good way to get yourself in with optional lower difficulties. If you're an old hand, the variety of classes and the optional higher difficulties can still give you a challenge.

Even though the game is free on te4.org, $8 is a complete steal for a game with this much replay value.

8033146.review:
Tales of Maj'Eyal is a roguelike with modern design.  Rather than being a simple dungeon crawler, it's a full-fledged RPG that plays like a roguelike - with more options for character building and more things to do.  Playing the game unlocks new races and classes to play, so permadeath isn't just a penalty, but a feature that lets you play something new and exciting.  Every race and class plays differently, so you will rarely lack for new things to do.

Bottom line: beneath the seemingly simple veneer is a great game that's more than worth your time and money.

8032520.review: ToME is what roguelikes should aspire to be. It's enormously complete, with tons of content, creative and an absolute bundle of fun. Although the graphics may seem primitive, the enormous, randomly generated gameworld and quests are easily going to give you a run for your money. The progression system is fair, and allows you to learn the game before giving you access to more complex, tactically challenging classes. Easily one of my favorite releases this year.

8032395.review: Really awesome game, If you havent played it yet, its your loss.

8032043.review: first of all, if you are interested in this go to the main site and download it for FREE! the difference between this paid version and the free is miniscule and let me tell you why. You get custom tiles that look cool but really nothing more then just a cosmetic thing. Exploration mode which just gives you infinate lives while nice! it sorta (in my opinion) takes away what makes a roguelike fun and thats perma death. The items vault that lets you share a small amount of items between character, i wont lie is nice but again isnt game breaking what so ever You also get ONE class a stone warden defensive class that only dwarves can use, while pretty nice is just but one class compared to the 26 classes you can already unlock and use in the free versin.  Now about the game itself! This game has a beautiful UI with custom nice looking icons for every thing, a DETAILED and easy to understand leveling system with talent points you can spend on a mix of features unique to EVERY(26) CLASS, a more common tree avalible to other classes, and stat points which you gain every level and distribute as you see fit. There is also a large amount of magical equipment drops with a balenced but wide variety of stats and effects to keep things interesting with your lewt! The best thing i love about ToME is that unlike most other roguelikes there is a variety of places to explore from dungeons to sand caves or  crystal caverns and theives dens! There are many other locations spread throughout the game world for you to find and explore. Some of the places you explore may unlock additional classes/races! did i mention the unlocks? yeah theres a lot and there nice. So i hope you read and this and found something you like from my review and decide to give this wonderful game a try.

8030860.review:
-Nice graphical (beginner-friendly) roguelike RPG with a lot of playing value-

I already loved the old version which was based in Tolkien's middle-earth and played like angband. The story has since been moved to a new campaign world. Also the classic scroll/potion-mechanic was traded in for a different system of cooldown abilities. Combat was overhauled for a faster streamlined experience -no farming, mobs don't respawn. Good for beginners although hardcore roguelike-veterans might miss typical roguelike chaos. Unlike other roguelikes the number of realistic interactions is low so you will not dip a rod in a potion or throw a ring in a sink here. No need to memorize 10000 key binds. Everything is already identified. The focus clearly lies on fighting monsters and straight action. Complexity is achieved by balancing your equipment, stats, and abilities + tactical fighting + knowing when to fight or run. 

Some features:
The game is as deadly as most roguelikes however permadeath can be switched off, too. Many advanced races and classes can be unlocked by actions in the game so there is always a reason to start the game anew and try a different combination. There is a built-in chat/news flash so you can read if another player gets wasted, hehe. High-Scores, Mods. Procedurally generated dungeons, static over-world with some dungeons/events randomly placed.

So:
I can recommend the game for most roguelike RPG fans - you can still download the full game for free and play it, then decide to donate or buy on steam if you liked it so you can't lose really.

8030701.review:
Don't be fooled by its looks, this game is great, deep and has a lot of content to offer.

This was the first roguelike I've dived into. It has a good tutorial mode to get into the game and the genre itself. 
Thanks to its visuals it's a lot more accessible than other good roguelikes. This was one of the major advantages for choosing this title over other roguelikes. 

The fact that this game is also really fun and rewarding also helps. :)

Of course you'll start out like any other RPG. You'll receive your quest and do what you want. Once you stand on the world map for the first time though it's up to you what you want to do.

You can unlock so much different classes, races and other things like an underground fortress to call as your home, trying out new classes, builds, racial combinations, you name it. Permadeath is no punishment, it's an opportunity to change your game once again.

8030188.review: Das wichtigste zu erst, das Spiel ist jeden Cent wert. Ihr habt die Möglichkeit es umsonst zu spielen indem ihr es auf der Webseite runterladet. Die heruntergeladene Version ist eine Vollversion (Ihr könnt das komplette Spiel durchspielen) bei der einige nice features fehlen wie z.b der Tresor mit dem ihr Items zwischen Charakteren hin und her bringen könnt, Custom Skins, der Unendlich Modus (wie der name schon sagt ein Modus mit unendlich viel leben, dient hauptsächlich dem zusammentragen von story logs ohne angst haben zu müssen das man stirbt) und natürlich die Stone Warden Klasse die mit zwei Schilden kämpft (sehr geil). Diese features erhält man indem man auf der Seite eine Donation an DarkGod macht oder indem man hier auf Steam kauft was einem zusätzlich das Steamtech UI und die wunderbaren 1225 Errungenschaften bringt :)) die ihr alle liebt. Jetzt zum Spiel Rogue Like wie mans gern hat viel strategie in den kämpfen tolle charakter klassen von Alchemist (hat Golem dabei) bis Guardian (Schild Schlag Baby) ist alles dabei was man erwartet mit unterschiedlichen Rassen und Klassen abhängigen Talentbäumen und Geschichten. Es gibt jede Menge zu entdecken und jede menge Monster zu töten. Nicht zu vergessen die andern Spielmodi |Arena *was man in der Arena so macht*|,| Roguelike *ein Leben*| und der Adventure Modus *hier gibt es bei bestimmten Charakterleveln ein leben zum vergeuden hinzu.Für 6 Euro grenzt es an Diebstahl :)) Wenn ihr unschlüssig seid kann ich euch nur empfehlen die Gratis Version auf der Tome4 Webseite runterzuladen das Spiel anzutesten und danach zuzuschlagen,auf Steam, ihr werdet es nicht bereuen, viel Spass beim sterben. Ich werde darüber ja im Chat informiert (achja ihr könnt mit andern Spielern online chatten unn euch daran erfreuen wenn wieder jemand seinen char über die Klinge springen gelassen hat, oder mit euren Items prahlen ) so ich muss weitermachen und DarkGod Heldenleichen gegen den Thron schmeissen.

8029367.review:
디아블로3가 가야했어야할 진정한방향을 제시하는게임

핵앤슬래시/아이템수집/캐릭터 성장에 완벽히 집중하는데 성공한 게임

다양한 아이템의 활용은 적지만 전장을 넓게사용하는 반턴제의 전투는 전략적인 플레이를 가능케하며 
또한 각 클래스는 일반적인 rpg에서는 보기힘든 굉장히 개성있는 스킬을 가지고 있어서 매플레이 새로운맛을 느낄수잇음.

디아블로에서 포션꿍쳐놓고 미친듯이 마셔가며 하는 플레이를 해소하기위한 inscription/rune 시스템은
쓸데없는 귀찮음을 해소함과 동시에 전략성과 긴장감을 동시에 잡았다.

또한 요즘 은근히 이런거많지만 싱글게임이면서 현재 플레이하고있는 다른사람과 채팅하고 아이템자랑하며 노는것도 쏠쏠한재미
게다가 서버에 굉장히 많은 통계를 저장해주어서 다른플레이어에게 자랑 및 자기기록보면서 흐뭇해하기 딱좋다. 
제작자인 DarkGod이 가끔 특수던전을 열어주기도함.

허나 반복적인 플레이를 요구하는 로그라이크치고 (죽지않는다는 하에) 한플레이가 너무 길고 쓸데없이 몹이 너무많은거는 호불호가 갈릴듯.
그리고 마지막으로 서버가 늘 좀 불안한데 DarkGod이 이걸로 돈많이벌어서 서버좀 좋은데로 옮겼으면 좋겟음.

쓸데없는 얼리억세스 게임사서 울지마시고 5년넘게 업데이트되서 컨텐츠 풍부한 Tome4를 해보시라.

스팀시스템때문에 플레이시간 얼마안되면서 이렇게 평가하는거처럼 보이겟지만 2년전부터 공식홈페이지에 donate해서 100시간넘게 플레이하고쓴글임

8027966.review:
If you like roguelikes - rogue, nethack, slash'em, stone soup, or even things that are similar-to-but-not-quite-roguelike - such as dark souls, rogue legacy, DiD playthroughs of games like skyrim, etc.. then this is almost a must have.  

Fantasy, turn based, w/the key roguelike elements of permadeath (no re-loading to your last save if you die, have to re-roll a new character and start over from scratch instead) and great difficulty (but not insurmountable).  Through your many deaths, however (and there will be many) - you will learn how to survive to the deeper reaches of the game.  

Great unique classes too.  Many of which are unlike any I have seen in any other game.  If u just enjoy speccing out characters in rpg's and mmo's then this game will scratch that itch too.  Though many of the classes need to be unlocked through achieving things in game in order to play them.

The game has a free version too, so you can try before you buy.  Buying makes you like a 'donator' and you get extra features like a class and a game-mode that free players can't get.  But you can play for free and still unlock the majority of things.  

I'm buying even though I already have the game and have been playing it for years, just because Darkgod and contributors have put so much good work into the game that if anyone deserves some of my game $, they do.  So if you're not sure about the game, give the free version a try, then come back and buy it if ya like it.

If you're not a patient person, or don't like difficult games, or you need your rpg's to be 3d or real time, then ya might wanna pass.  But otherwise, worth checking out.  One of my favourite games.

8027311.review:
looks can be decieving.

After 2 hours of play, I certainly get why this is roguelike of the (many) year(s). I liked DoD but this is something else, way more full of experiences with little grinding.

BTW, verdict is the same after additional play hours. This is one game that does not waste your time. Full of things to do, full of strange tales to take part in.

8027010.review:
До выхода в стиме наиграл в этот рогалик больше сотни часов и могу сказать что это отличный рогалик/рпг, от собратьевт по жанру таких как ADOM, Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup, dungeon of dredmor отличает хороший сюжет а главное ОГРОМНОЕ количество открываемого контента.
 В самом начале игры открыты вполне обычные класы типа воин, маг, алхимик, рога, но по мере прохождения можно открыть например мастера рукопашного боя дерущегося захватами в ближнем бою или мага парадоксов который может упровлять временем и пространством и это не просто заклинания по типу кинул замедление, а например можно призвать себя из будущего себе на помощь и если вы победите то когданибудь в дальнейшем вас внезапно может телепортировать к себе прошлому на помощь!! И конечно же в игре у каждого класа есть свой набор уникальных навыков.
Вся эта тона контента позволяет играть и играть в этот рогалик пока не откроешь весь контент.

8025763.review: I bought tales of Maj'Eyal way WAY back when it was still in beta, long before Greenlight was around. It was worth my $10 then, and it was absolutely worth another $6 now. It's an absolutely fantastic game that is probably the best Roguelike I've ever played. There's tons of depth, lots of great classes, a great campaign - I've sunk probably hundreds of hours on it already. Every game is different/fun/exciting in a new way. There's enough difficulty options to tune it for any person of any skill level, and even experienced veterans of the game will find plenty of additional challenges after they've finished the main campaign once or twice.

Play this game!!
